wikipedia_page.main: Edgar 'Eddie' Long (1907–31 January 1958) was a Welsh international rugby union flanker who played club rugby for Swansea and was capped seven times for Wales. He is best remembered not for his international duties, but for his marshalling of the Swansea pack during the club's victory of the 1935 touring New Zealand team.

response: *31 January – Edgar Long, Wales international rugby player
